title: Iran Backpedals on Executions Threat but Casts Protesters as ‘Terrorists’
summary: Iran’s judiciary said there was no death penalty issued for Erfan Soltani, whose case drew international outcry. Analysts say the government is using fear and intimidation to keep people off the streets.

title: Why Israel Is Wary of Intervening in Iran
summary: Israel is unlikely to do much to try to precipitate a regime change in Iran, seeing the government as far from the brink of collapse and the current protests as insufficient to push it to that point.

title: Under Trump, a Shift Toward ‘Absolute Immunity’ for ICE
summary: Since the fatal shooting of Renee Good in Minneapolis, administration officials have defended the use of deadly force, which agency guidelines say should be a last resort.

title: Inside an ICE Confrontation in Minneapolis
summary: Our visual journalists David Guttenfelder and Todd Heisler describe a dramatic incident in which federal agents dragged a woman out of her car in Minneapolis near where Renee Nicole Good had been killed days before.

title: Appeals Court Opens the Door to Mahmoud Khalil’s Rearrest
summary: Any new detention would not come immediately, and Mr. Khalil’s lawyers plan to appeal. But the ruling is a major blow to Mr. Khalil, a Columbia graduate and prominent figure in the pro-Palestinian movement.

title: Harvard Slips on a Global Ranking List, as Chinese Schools Surge Ahead
summary: Harvard still dominates, though it fell to No. 3 on a list measuring academic output. Other American universities are falling farther behind their global peers.

title: Venezuela Strongman and Maduro Ally, Diosdado Cabello, Faces an Uneasy Transition
summary: Diosdado Cabello, Venezuela’s interior minister, is accused by U.S. prosecutors of drug trafficking and is linked to repression at home, yet remains a powerful figure.

title: Nobel Committee Takes Heat at Home as Machado Courts Trump in D.C.
summary: The Venezuelan opposition leader’s attempts to share her award with the U.S. president have shaken some Norwegians’ faith in their signature soft-power tool.

title: The Judge in the Maduro Case Is 92. All Eyes Will Be on His Stamina.
summary: Judge Alvin K. Hellerstein was seen drifting in and out of sleep in court last year. The case of Nicolás Maduro, the Venezuelan leader, will test his endurance.

title: U.S. Cuts Health Aid and Ties It to Funding Pledges by African Governments
summary: The Trump administration has signed $11 billion in agreements with African nations, in deals tied to foreign policy goals.

title: For the World’s Food Supply, Federal Funding Cuts Have Long-Term Impacts
summary: The U.S. Agency for International Development has been a major supporter of global agriculture research. Now many studies are being scuttled or scaled back.

title: Trump Outlines Health Care Proposals as Prices and Premiums Rise
summary: The long-awaited plan would leave much to Congress and calls for payments to health savings accounts rather than insurance subsidies, among other broad proposals.

title: After an Inconclusive Meeting With Trump Administration Officials Over Greenland’s Future, What’s Next?
summary: A high-powered meeting in Washington on Wednesday ended in an impasse, leaving Greenlanders fearful of what comes next.

title: Russia Knocks Out the Heat in Ukraine
summary: The Kremlin has tried for years to freeze Ukraine into submission. This winter, its attacks have been the most devastating ever.

title: The Priest, the Financier and the $10 Millon Townhouse
summary: When a pastor learned his childhood home might undergo a glow-up, he saw his beloved Brooklyn further receding — and took to a different kind of pulpit.

title: Coinbase, the Biggest U.S. Crypto Company, Asserts Its Power in Washington
summary: The top executive of the crypto exchange Coinbase scuttled a planned Senate committee vote on a major cryptocurrency bill after voicing his concerns, a sign of the company’s clout.

title: Why Trump Always Thanks You ‘For Your Attention to This Matter’
summary: How a simple catchphrase sums up the president’s theory of executive power.

title: The Truth About Weight-Loss Drugs Like Ozempic: You Probably Need Them Forever
summary: Many people who use these medications don’t want to stay on them long term. But research has repeatedly shown that quitting the drugs means gaining back weight.

title: NASA Astronauts Return to Earth After Medical Evacuation From International Space Station
summary: The members of Crew-11 — two American, one Russian and one Japanese — splashed down after one became ill, prompting an early return.

title: Why Are We Still So Afraid of Using the Grumpy Old Period?
summary: Exclamation marks, ellipses and ‘haha’ can’t fix our growing inability to communicate.

title: Something Is Rotten in the State of America
summary: This is the thanks Demark gets?

title: Democrats Will Lose in 2028 Unless They Change Course Now
summary: Despite the successes of 2025, the party still needs a radical shake-up.

title: Greenland’s Future
summary: We examine the debate over the Arctic island and what residents are saying.

title: Weather Detours a Scientific Expedition to Antarctica’s Thwaites Glacier
summary: Bad weather has postponed attempts to set up camp on the Thwaites Glacier. So researchers got onto the sea ice and met a local.

title: A Look At Antarctica From Above
summary: After nearly two weeks at sea without being able to launch his drone, New York Times photographer Chang W. Lee finally captures Antarctica from the air.

title: Earnings Fall Short at Bank of America, Citi, JPMorgan and Wells Fargo
summary: This week, Bank of America, Citi, JPMorgan and Wells Fargo released fraught earnings reports as President Trump’s threatened cap on credit card rates loomed large.

title: ‘Hell’s Kitchen’ Will End Broadway Run and Open Overseas
summary: Though the show will close in New York next month, a North American tour will continue, and productions in Australia, Germany and South Korea are planned.

title: Elon Musk’s X Restricts Ability to Create Explicit Images With Grok
summary: Bowing to pressure, the company said it would restrict X users from generating explicit images of real people in jurisdictions where such content is illegal.
